trial_identification.studytitle: Does the respiratory function of obese individuals retrun to normal following surgically-induced weight reduction?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Does the respiratory function of obese individuals retrun to normal following surgically-induced weight reduction?

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal development and function of the respiratory system

interventions.interventions: This is an observational study on subjects who are undergoing gastric banding for obesity - the initial visit will take place before surgery and the follow-up visit will take place 6 months later.. The study itself has no interventions. Study subjects will be matched with controls and they will have a one off visit around the time of the 6 month follow up for the surgery patient.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Respiratory function (both static and under exercise) in both those undergoing surgery and controls
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measurements will be made before and 6 months after surgery

primaryOutcome.outcome: Body fat distribution as measured by Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DEXA) in both those undergoing surgery and controls
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measurements will be made before and 6 months after surgery

primaryOutcome.outcome: Anthropometry in both those undergoing surgery and controls
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measurements will be made before and 6 months after surgery

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Any subjects listed for gastric banding will be approached.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The only exclusion criteria are if there are any contraindications to the testing being performed, e.g. epilepsy and methacholine challenge.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: we are applying for money from local sources, for example the University of Otago Research Grant

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study will compare respiratory function at rest and exercise in patients undergoing gastric banding for obesity. They will be compared to similar weight individuals who do not have surgery.
